page.title: 04PROCTOR'S PARK
page.content:
Proctor's Park is a residential caravan site. It is by the River Soar. If you walk down Bridge Street you come to the park half way down on the left. Mr. Proctor owns the park and it is roughly about 2 acres of grass, water and concrete. There are about 400 caravans on the site. It is quite a nice place to camp as it is near the river and there is a lot of wildlife nearby. The road that it is on (Bridge Street) is quite a noisy street but you cannot hear much of the traffic from the park. There are some very pleasant walks, and there are quite a few fields round about.
{Bryony Morrison
